subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Loss and Anxiety
description: A quick, practical guide to Sleep Loss and Anxiety.

hook.text: A single night of total sleep deprivation increases anxiety levels by 30 percent in healthy volunteers.

buildup.text: The medial prefrontal cortex, which normally calms the amygdala, goes offline without sufficient sleep.

discovery.text: Brain scans show a direct connection: less deep sleep predicts more anxiety the following day.

twist.text: Conversely, a night of solid deep sleep reduces anxiety levels. It works both directions.

climax.text: Researchers now consider sleep disruption not just a symptom of anxiety but a potential cause of it.

punchline.text: Anxiety may start in your bedroom, not your mind.
